===1901–1950===
===1901–1950===

[[File:Admin 1930s.jpg|thumb|left|The Administration Building, c. 1935.{{deletable image-caption|Thursday, 29 September 2011}}]]
With the addition of a law school and medical school in 1905, St. John's College became Fordham University in 1907. The name ''Fordham'' ("[[ford (crossing)|ford]] by the [[hamlet (place)|hamlet]]") refers to the [[Fordham, Bronx|Fordham]] neighborhood of [[the Bronx]] in which the Rose Hill campus is located. This neighborhood was named either as a reference to its location near a shallow crossing of the [[Bronx River]] or as a reference to Rev. John Fordham, an [[Anglican]] priest.<ref name="History"/>
With the addition of a law school and medical school in 1905, St. John's College became Fordham University in 1907. The name ''Fordham'' ("[[ford (crossing)|ford]] by the [[hamlet (place)|hamlet]]") refers to the [[Fordham, Bronx|Fordham]] neighborhood of [[the Bronx]] in which the Rose Hill campus is located. This neighborhood was named either as a reference to its location near a shallow crossing of the [[Bronx River]] or as a reference to Rev. John Fordham, an [[Anglican]] priest.<ref name="History"/>
